parameters.description: Return only items with the given IDs.
parameters.name: itemids

parameters.description: Return only items that belong to the hosts from the given groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only items that belong to the given templates.
parameters.name: templateids

parameters.description: Return only items that belong to the given hosts.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only items that are monitored by the given proxies.
parameters.name: proxyids

parameters.description: Return only items that use the given host interfaces.
parameters.name: interfaceids

parameters.description: Return only items that are used in the given graphs.
parameters.name: graphids

parameters.description: Return only items that are used in the given triggers.
parameters.name: triggerids

parameters.description: Include web items in the result.
parameters.name: webitems

parameters.description: If set to true return only items inherited from a template.
parameters.name: inherited

parameters.description: If set to true return only items that belong to templates.
parameters.name: templated

parameters.description: If set to true return only enabled items that belong to monitored hosts.
parameters.name: monitored

parameters.description: Return only items that belong to a group with the given name.
parameters.name: group

parameters.description: Return only items that belong to a host with the given name.
parameters.name: host

parameters.description:
Rules for tag searching.

Possible values:
0 - (default) And/Or;
2 - Or.
parameters.name: evaltype

parameters.description:
Return only items with given tags. Exact match by tag and case-sensitive or case-insensitive search by tag value depending on operator value.
Format: [{"tag": "<tag>", "value": "<value>", "operator": "<operator>"}, ...].
An empty array returns all items.

Possible operator types:
0 - (default) Like;
1 - Equal;
2 - Not like;
3 - Not equal;
4 - Exists;
5 - Not exists.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: If set to true return only items that are used in triggers.
parameters.name: with_triggers

parameters.description: Return a hosts property with an array of hosts that the item belongs to.
parameters.name: selectHosts

parameters.description: Return an interfaces property with an array of host interfaces used by the item.
parameters.name: selectInterfaces

parameters.description:
Return a triggers property with the triggers that the item is used in.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectTriggers

parameters.description:
Return a graphs property with the graphs that contain the item.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectGraphs

parameters.description: Return a discoveryRule property with the LLD rule that created the item.
parameters.name: selectDiscoveryRule

parameters.description:
Return an itemDiscovery property with the item discovery object. The item discovery object links the item to an item prototype from which it was created.

It has the following properties:
itemdiscoveryid - (string) ID of the item discovery;
itemid - (string) ID of the discovered item;
parent_itemid - (string) ID of the item prototype from which the item has been created;
key_ - (string) key of the item prototype;
lastcheck - (timestamp) time when the item was last discovered;
status - (int) item discovery status:
0 - (default) item is discovered,
1 - item is not discovered anymore;
ts_delete - (timestamp) time when an item that is no longer discovered will be deleted;
ts_disable - (timestamp) time when an item that is no longer discovered will be disabled;
disable_source - (int) indicator of whether item was disabled by an LLD rule or manually:
0 - (default) disabled automatically,
1 - disabled by an LLD rule.
parameters.name: selectItemDiscovery

parameters.description: Return a preprocessing property with item preprocessing options.
parameters.name: selectPreprocessing

parameters.description: Return the item tags in tags property.
parameters.name: selectTags

parameters.description: Return a valuemap property with item value map.
parameters.name: selectValueMap

parameters.description:
Return only those results that exactly match the given filter.

Accepts an object, where the keys are property names, and the values are either a single value or an array of values to match against.

Does not support properties of text data type.

Supports additional properties:
host - technical name of the host that the item belongs to.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description:
Limits the number of records returned by subselects.

Applies to the following subselects:
selectGraphs - results will be sorted by name;
selectTriggers - results will be sorted by description.
parameters.name: limitSelects

parameters.description:
Sort the result by the given properties.

Possible values: itemid, name, key_, delay, history, trends, type, status.
parameters.name: sortfield

parameters.description: rowspan="11">These parameters being common for all get methods are described in detail in the reference commentary page.
parameters.name: countOutput

parameters.description: Return the number of records in the result instead of the actual data.
parameters.name: countOutput

parameters.description: If set to true return only objects that the user has write permissions to.  Default: false.
parameters.name: editable

parameters.description: Return results that do not match the criteria given in the search parameter.
parameters.name: excludeSearch

parameters.description: Return only those results that exactly match the given filter. Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are either a single value or an array of values to match against. Doesn't work for text fields.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Limit the number of records returned.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Object properties to be returned. Default: extend.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Use IDs as keys in the resulting array.
parameters.name: preservekeys

parameters.description: Return results that match the given wildcard search (case-insensitive). Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are strings to search for. If no additional options are given, this will perform a LIKE "%â€¦%" search. Works only for string and text fields.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: If set to true return results that match any of the criteria given in the filter or search parameter instead of all of them. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchByAny

parameters.description: If set to true enables the use of "*" as a wildcard character in the search parameter. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchWildcardsEnabled

parameters.description: Sort the result by the given properties. Refer to a specific API get method description for a list of properties that can be used for sorting. Macros are not expanded before sorting. If no value is specified, data will be returned unsorted.
parameters.name: sortfield

parameters.description: Order of sorting. If an array is passed, each value will be matched to the corresponding property given in the sortfield parameter.
parameters.name: sortorder

parameters.description: The search parameter will compare the beginning of fields, that is, perform a LIKE "â€¦%" search instead. Ignored if searchWildcardsEnabled is set to true.
parameters.name: startSearch
